- You can't use your ability night 1

You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.article.role.mafioso.extra: * You can't target other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.serialKiller.reminder: Each night, select a player to attack.
wiki.article.role.serialKiller.guide:
- At night select a player to attack them
- You can't use your ability night 1.
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.r: Choose a syndicate killing role to become that role when night starts.
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.g:
* Choose a syndicate killing role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You likely can't become a role if someone already has that role (You can't become a role that has exceeded its role limit)
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.a: * Become a role you choose at the start of night

* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can not become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.e:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the Syndicate Killing Wildcard
* You can choose Syndicate Killing Wildcard to stay as Syndicate Killing Wildcard
* You can't become a role that is at its role limit, for example, you can't become a godfather even if there is already one in the game, even if that godfather is dead
wiki.article.role.goon.reminder: No ability besides being a syndicate insider.
wiki.article.role.goon.guide: You have no night time ability besides chatting with the syndicate. Try to help the syndicate come up with lies and come up with a fake claim.
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.reminder: Each night, select a player to roleblock and/or send false messages.
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.guide:
- At night, select a player to roleblock or hypnotize
- If you roleblock your target, they can not use their ability that night
- You can choose to send a false message to your target, or to not send them the message saying they are roleblocked
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.abilities:
* Visit a player to roleblock and choose a message to show them
    * You can send that they were attempted to be roleblocked
    * You can send that they were attacked but had defense
    * You can send that they were protected by someone
    * You can send that they were transported
    * You can send that they were attempted to be possessed
    * You can send that they are wardblocked
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.attributes:
* You are immune to roleblocks
* You may choose to not roleblock your target
* You can't choose to send no messages
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.extra:
* You can't select other syndicate members
* When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.article.role.consort.reminder: Each night, select a player to roleblock.
wiki.article.role.consort.guide:
- At night, select a player to roleblock them, stopping them from using their ability
- Your target is told they were roleblocked

_For example_
- A consort selects the vigilante, so the vigilante can't kill anyone, and nobody dies
wiki.article.role.consort.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock them
wiki.article.role.consort.attributes:
* You can't be roleblocked
* Your target is told when they are roleblocked, even if they are immune to being roleblocked
wiki.article.role.consort.extra:
* When someone is roleblocked, their visits are wiped, so they don't visit anyone
* You can't select other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.reminder: Each night, select a player to silence, that player forfeits their vote during the next day.
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.guide:
- At night, select a player to silence
- The silenced player can't speak during the next day, and they can't vote during the next nomination

You should choose talkative players who might speak out against a syndicate member, or players who have information that you want to suppress.
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.abilities: * Visit a player to silence them during the next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.attributes:
* Silenced players are forced to forfeit vote during the next day
* Silenced players can not talk in chat or out loud during the entire next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.extra:
* The silenced player is no longer be silenced at the start of the next night
* You cannot select other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.informant.reminder: Each night, select a player to learn their role, who visits them, and who they visited. You can see all whispers.
wiki.article.role.informant.guide:
- At night, select a player to learn:
    - Their role
    - Who they visited
    - Who visited them
- You can read whispers that were sent to other players

You should communicate the information you get to the rest of the syndicate. It is fairly easy to fake claim lookout or tracker.
wiki.article.role.informant.abilities:
* Visit a player to
    * Learn their role
    * Learn who visited them
    * Learn who they visited
* All whispers can be read regardless of whether or not they were sent to you
wiki.article.role.informant.extra: * You can't select other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.necromancer.guide: You can select a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player you select. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can not possess the same player more than twice.
wiki.article.role.necromancer.abilities:
* Visit 2 players to make the first player visit the second player
* The first player you select must appear as a dead player in the graveyard
wiki.article.role.necromancer.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
* You can't select a dead player who you have previously possessed
wiki.article.role.necromancer.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked or possessed
* You can force your target to visit any living player
* If you don't successfully possess the player you select, you can select them again
* All your visits except the first are cleared after you change your targets visits
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.mafiaWitch.guide:
- At night, possess a player by selecting 2 players
    - The first player you select will be forced to visit the second player you select

_For example_
- You can posses a vigilante to attack another townie by selecting the vigilante first and the townie second
wiki.article.role.mafiaWitch.abilities: * Visit 2 players to make the first player visit the second player
wiki.article.role.mafiaWitch.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
wiki.article.role.mafiaWitch.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* You can't select other syndicate members for your first target, but you can select any living player for your second target
* Your second target gets erased after you change your targets visit, so no other roles can interact with it
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.mortician.reminder: Each night, select a player to tag them for obscuring. If they die, their role and alibi are hidden.
wiki.article.role.mortician.guide:
- At night, select a player to tag them for obscuring
    - A player who is tagged for obscuring gets obscured when they die, erasing their role and alibi from their grave so nobody knows who they are
    - You are told the obscured players role and alibi when they die
- You can tag as many players as you want, but you can only obscure X players (X = Total players √∑ 5 (round up))
wiki.article.role.mortician.abilities:
* Visit a player to tag them for obscuring
* If a player is obscured, that player's role and alibi do not appear in the graveyard
* You are told the role and alibi of the player you obscured when they die.
wiki.article.role.mortician.attributes:
* You can only ever obscure X players per game (X = Total players √∑ 5 (round up))
* You can't select a player who is already tagged
* You can target other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.mortician.extra:
* You can target other syndicate members, but not yourself
* Your ability doesn't work after you are dead
- You can't select a player who is already tagged
wiki.article.role.forger.reminder: At night, select a player, if they die, their role and alibi on their grave is forged.
wiki.article.role.forger.guide:
- At night, select a player who dies to forge their role and alibi
- Forging a player on the night they die allows you to edit their role and alibi in their grave
- You can use your ability X times (X = Total players √∑ 5 (round up))

You should select the same player as the godfather or syndicate killing so your ability actually works.
wiki.article.role.forger.abilities:
* Visit a player to forge their grave only if they die tonight
* If a grave is forged, that player's role and alibi appear to be what you choose
* You are told the original role and alibi of the player you forge
wiki.article.role.forger.attributes:
* You only have X uses of your ability (X = Total players √∑ 5 (round up))
- You can copy paste chat messages
wiki.article.role.forger.extra:
* If you visit a player to attempt to forge them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
* If you are blocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
* You can't target other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.framer.reminder: Each night, select a player to give suspicious aura. If you select 2 players, the first player appears to visit the second player.
wiki.article.role.framer.guide:
- At night, select a player to frame
    - Framed players have suspicious aura
    - A player loses the framed status after being visited by any town investigative role
- If you select 2 players
    - The first is framed
    - The first player appears to visit the second player for that night
    - Your second visit is removed

_For example_
- You select @15 and @12. The godfather selects @12. A separate tracker selects @15 and sees that @15 visits @12. Since @12 dies, the tracker might think that @15 was the killer.
wiki.article.role.framer.abilities:
* Visit a player to frame
    - Framed players have suspicious aura
    - A player stops being framed when a town investigative role visits them
* Visit 2 players to
  * Frame the first player
  * The first players appear to visit the second player you visit
 - Your second visit is removed
wiki.article.role.framer.attributes:
- For the first visit, you can select living players who aren't insiders with you
- You can select anyone for the second visit, even dead players or yourself
wiki.article.role.framer.extra:
- Your second visit is removed, so no other roles can interact with it
    - A tracker only sees you visit your first target
    - The marksman wont see you visit the second target
    - You don't die if your second target is an veteran who is rampaging
wiki.article.role.disguiser.reminder: At night, choose an insider to permanently disguise, giving them innocent aura, armor, and make their role appear wrong on their grave.
wiki.article.role.disguiser.guide:
- At night, select a player to disguise
    - The player you visit becomes your disguised target until you select another player, or they die, or you die
    - The disguised player has an innocent aura
    - The disguised player has their role appear to be what you chose on their grave
    - You can disguise any player in your insider group, including yourself
wiki.article.role.disguiser.abilities:
- At night, select a player to disguise
    - The player you visit becomes your disguised target until you select another player, or they die, or you die
    - The disguised player has an innocent aura
    - The disguised player has their role appear to be what you chose on their grave
    - You can disguise any player in your insider group, including yourself
wiki.article.role.disguiser.attributes: - When the disguised player dies, you choose what role is on their grave, and can choose that role up until the moment they die
wiki.article.role.disguiser.extra:
- You can typically only visit other living syndicate insiders, so be careful of enemy spies
- You can change the role on your own grave assuming you have disguised yourself
- If you visit a non fellow insider, your ability does nothing
wiki.article.role.reeducator.reminder: At night, choose a fellow insider to become a syndicate support role that you choose. Once per game, convert a player to join the syndicate.
wiki.article.role.reeducator.guide:
- At night, either select a player and syndicate support role
    - If you select a syndicate insider
        - Their role switches to the role you choose
    - If you select someone who isn't a syndicate insider
        - Their role switches to the role you choose
        - They become a syndicate insider
        - They become a syndicate loyalist
        - You can only convert somebody once, if you visit a non syndicate insider again, your ability does nothing
- On night 1, you can only select fellow insiders
- If the reeducator is randomly generated, a non reeducator syndicate insider has their role switched to a random town role before the game starts, they never know of this
wiki.article.role.reeducator.abilities:
- At night, either select a player and syndicate support role
    - If you select a syndicate insider
        - Their role switches to the role you choose
    - If you select someone who isn't a syndicate insider
        - Their role switches to the role you choose
        - They become a syndicate insider
        - They become a syndicate loyalist
        - You can only convert somebody once, if you visit a non syndicate insider again, your ability does nothing
- On night 1, you can only select fellow insiders
- If the reeducator is randomly generated, a non reeducator syndicate insider has their role switched to a random town role before the game starts, they never know of this
wiki.article.role.reeducator.attributes:
- After you convert somebody, you can't select non-insiders anymore
- Converting a non-syndicate insider to join the syndicate does a defense check, it has an attack power of basic
- If the convert is blocked by defense, the charge is not consumed
- You can't convert a non syndicate insider on night 1
- You can select yourself
wiki.article.role.reeducator.extra:
- Players roles switch after night ends, so their ability still happens for tonight
- You can't select roles that aren't enabled
wiki.article.role.cupid.guide:
- At night, select 2 players to love link
* The players are told they are love linked, if one of them dies, the other dies of a broken heart
wiki.article.role.cupid.abilities:
- Visit 2 players to love link them
    - If one of them dies, the other dies of a broken heart immediately
    - If one of the players you visit dies on the night you try to love link them, they don't link.
wiki.article.role.cupid.attributes:
- The player that dies of a broken heart dies separate from night deaths
-    The love linked players are told that they are love linked
wiki.article.role.cupid.extra: - You can't select yourself or other syndicate members
wiki.article.role.mafiaSupportWildcard.g:
* Choose a syndicate support role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You likely can't become a role if someone already has that role (You can't become a role that has exceeded its role limit)
wiki.article.role.mafiaSupportWildcard.a: * Become a role you choose at the start of night

* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can not become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.mafiaSupportWildcard.e:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the Syndicate Support Wildcard
* You can choose Syndicate Wildcard to stay as Syndicate Wildcard
* You can't become a role that is at its role limit, for example, you can't become a witch even if there is already one in the game, even if that witch is dead
wiki.article.role.jester.reminder: If you are executed you win, after you are executed, you must kill a player.
wiki.article.role.jester.guide:
- Get executed during the day to win
- After you win by getting executed, you can attack any living player who voted you guilty or abstained

Try to look evil so people vote you, without making it obvious that you are the Jester.
wiki.article.role.jester.abilities:
* When you are executed, you win
* On the night after you are executed, attack the player you select
wiki.article.role.jester.attributes:
* You always have an innocent aura
* If you select nobody on the night after you are executed, you will attack a random living player who did not vote you innocent
* You have a protection-piercing, indirect attack
wiki.article.role.jester.extra: * Your attack is indirect, so nothing can effect it
wiki.article.role.revolutionary.reminder: If your target is executed you win, after you win you leave town.
wiki.article.role.revolutionary.guide:
- Get your execution target executed to win
 When you win, you leave town at the start of night

You should try to claim something that makes people think your target is evil.
wiki.article.role.revolutionary.abilitie:
* At the beginning of the game, you are assigned an execution target. It is a random townie, but never a Mayor, Reporter, Jailor, Deputy, Veteran, or Transporter
* Your execution targets role is revealed to you when you are assigned that target
wiki.article.role.revolutionary.attribut:
* When your execution target is executed, you win
* After you win, you leave town at the start of final words
* You are armored
wiki.article.role.revolutionary.extra:
* If your target dies by something other than execution, you convert to a jester immediately, even while dead
* If there are no valid targets in the game when you become the Revolutionary, you convert to a Jester
wiki.article.role.geist.reminder: Each night, transport a player with yourself. Protect both players. If you recieve an attacking visit, you win and kill attacking town loyalists.
wiki.article.role.geist.guide:
- At night, select a player to transport with yourself and protect both players
 - If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they instead visit the second player and vice versa.
    - If you receive an attacking visit: the visitor dies, you win the game, and you leave town
wiki.article.role.geist.abilities:
- Visit a player to transport them with you
 - You protect your target and yourself 
 - You can't select yourself
wiki.article.role.geist.attributes:
-  All visits to first player instead visit the second player and vice versa
 - The first players you transport are told they are transported
 - You are immune to getting roleblocked, transported, or possessed
 - You have armor
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.reminder: Guess the role of three different players correctly to win. When you win you attack the players you guessed.
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.guide:
- Guess the role of three different players correctly to win
- If you get all your guesses correct and win, you attack all three players, and then leave town
- You can't guess town investigative roles
- If a player has a non town role, you don't need to guess their exact role, just that they are non town

 In order to counter a doomsayer, players often claimswap
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.abilities: * Use the Doomsayer menu to guess the role of three different living players in one night, attacking them and winning
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.attributes:
* When you win, you leave town at the start of the next obituary
* You have to guess the exact role of townies, but you only need to guess the faction of all other roles
* You can't try to guess town investigative roles
* When there are not enough players left for you to guess, you convert to a jester
* You have an indirect, protection-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.extra:
* Your three guesses must be three different players
* If the players you guessed correctly don't die, you still win
* You do not visit when you attack
* You can't try to guess a martyr
* If you are blocked, your ability does nothing
wiki.article.role.chronokaiser.reminder: Each day while you are alive, time speeds up by 60%. You win if you live to the end of the game.
wiki.article.role.chronokaiser.guide:
- Each day while you are alive, time speeds up by 60%
 - Every discussion phase, the amount that you sped up the game is announced in chat
 - If you are alive at the end of the game, you win
wiki.article.role.chronokaiser.abilities:
* You passively speed up the game by 60%
- If you are alive at the end of the game, you win
wiki.article.role.chronokaiser.attribute:
* You have no night time ability
* Everyone is told how much you sped up the game each day
wiki.article.role.chronokaiser.extra:
* Roleblocking doesn't effect your ability
 If there are multiple Chronokaisers, the message is sent twice during discussion, and the game is sped up twice
wiki.article.role.martyr.reminder: If you die, you win, and everyone else dies too
wiki.article.role.martyr.guide: If you die, you win, and everyone commits suicide in an attempt to follow you to the afterlife. The entire town knows that you're the martyr. Good Luck!
wiki.article.role.martyr.abilities:
* Visit yourself to attack yourself and spend one bullet
* You start with 2 bullets
* When you die, everyone else commits suicide and you win.
wiki.article.role.martyr.attributes:
* When you have zero bullets left, you leave town and lose
* You have a basic attack
wiki.article.role.martyr.extra:
* When you visit a player while you have zero bullets left you will not attack them
* You're an ex-cultist, they rejected you because you told the truth
wiki.article.role.drunk.reminder: You are told you are a town investigate role, not the drunk, but you get dubious information.
wiki.article.role.drunk.guide:
Before the game starts, whoever gets this role switches roles without being told, and they become confused until the end of the game. Their role switches to either Detective, Philosopher, Snoop, Gossip, Tally Clerk, Auditor, or Psychic
 - This means that if you got one of those roles, you could be confused and not even know it.
 - The drunk is a town loyalist, so you still win with town.
 - You have suspicious aura
 - If your role changes, you stop being confused and you don't have suspicious aura anymore.
wiki.article.role.wildcard.guide:
* Choose a role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You can't become a role that is disabled or taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.wildcard.abilities: * Become a role you choose at the start of night
wiki.article.role.wildcard.attributes:
* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can not become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.wildcard.extra:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the Wildcard
* You can choose wildcard to stay as wildcard
* You can't become a role that is at its role limit, if there is a veteran in the game, you can't become one, even if the veteran is dead
wiki.article.role.trueWildcard.guide:
* Choose a role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You can't become a role that is disabled, but you can become a role that is taken, so there can be 2 veterans
wiki.article.role.trueWildcard.abilities: * Become a role you choose at the start of night
wiki.article.role.trueWildcard.attribute:
* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.trueWildcard.extra:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the True Wildcard
* You can choose true wildcard to stay as true wildcard
* You can become a role that is at its role limit, if there is a veteran in the game, you still can become one
wiki.article.role.witch.guide:
- You win if town loses, when town loses you leave town
- At night, possess a player by selecting 2 players
    - The first player you select will be forced to visit the second player you select

_For example_
- You can posses a vigilante to attack another townie by selecting the vigilante first and the townie second
wiki.article.role.witch.abilities:
* Visit 2 players to make the first player visit the second player
* If there are no living townies, you win, and leave town at the start of the next phase
wiki.article.role.witch.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
wiki.article.role.witch.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* Your second target gets erased after you change your targets visit, so no other roles can interact with it
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.scarecrow.reminder: Each night, select a player to ward them, everyone you wardblock is revealed to you.
wiki.article.role.scarecrow.guide:
- You win if town loses, when town loses you leave town
- At night, select a player to ward them, stopping almost all abilities from working on them.
    - You are told who you wardblocked, and their roles are revealed to you

_For Example_
- A detective attempts to investigate @11 but you warded @11, so the detective gets wardblocked and doesn't learn anything, but you learn that you stopped the @11

You aren't told players who are wardblock immune because you can't wardblock them
wiki.article.role.scarecrow.abilities:
* Visit a player to ward them
    - Everyone visitor to your target has their visits erased, and receives a chat message informing them they are wardblocked
- You are told who you wardblocked, and they are revealed
- If there are no living townies, you win, and leave town at the start of the next phase
wiki.article.role.scarecrow.attributes: * Your target isn't told they are warded
wiki.article.role.scarecrow.extra:
* You can't select yourself
* You are immune to roleblocks, wardblocks, and possession
- You aren't told the names of players who aren't wardblocked, even if they still somehow visit your target, for example, a bouncer is wardblock immune
wiki.article.role.kidnapper.reminder: Each day, choose a player to detain. At night, talk to your prisoner, and decide weather or not kill them, with a max of 1 attack use. You appear the same as a jailor to your prisoner.
wiki.article.role.kidnapper.guide:
- Each day, choose a player to kidnap. At night, you interrogate them in text chat
- You can kill your prisoner one time
- You can talk to your prisoner during the night, and they are not told who you are
- The players you kidnap are warded and roleblocked.
wiki.article.role.kidnapper.abilities:
* Choose one player to kidnap during the day
* Visit your prisoner to attack them
- If you kill your prisoner, their grave shows that they were killed by a jailor
wiki.article.role.kidnapper.attributes:
* You may talk with your prisoner at night in kidnapped chat
* Players you kidnap are warded and roleblocked, they also can't select anybody
wiki.article.role.kidnapper.extra:
* The Kidnapper can not kill someone on night one
* You roleblock the player you detain
* Players you kidnap don't see your name on your messages. The messages you send appear to be from the jailor
* If you kidnap a cult or syndicate member, their teammates are told that player is in jail
wiki.article.role.warper.reminder: Each night, select two players, all visits to the first player are redirected to the second.
wiki.article.role.warper.guide:
- At night, select 2 players
    - If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they instead visit the second player
    - The first player is told they are transported, but the second is not
    - You can't choose yourself as your first target, you can't warp yourself
- You are told the role of your first target

 _For example_
- If a godfather tries to attack @1, but you warped @1 to @4, then @4 will die instead, and @1 is told they are transported

You are a minion, so you should try to harm the town as much as possible while looking to benefit non-town players.
wiki.article.role.warper.abilities:
- Visit 2 players to warp visits from the first player to the second player
 - You can't select yourself as the first target, you cannot warp yourself
- You are told the role of your first target
wiki.article.role.warper.attributes:
-  All visits to first player instead visit the second player
 - The first player you visit is told they were transported
wiki.article.role.warper.extra:
- Some abilities are not affected by yours due to the priority system. _For example_ You can't stop a jester from haunting their target using a transport, this depends on priorities and whether or not an ability is indirect
* Warpers act after transporters
* Warpers do not warp the visits of a transporter
wiki.article.role.politician.reminder: If town is about to win, you win instead, and kill all non-politicians.
wiki.article.role.politician.guide:
* If the town would win, instead the game skips to nomination, if you survive until the next dusk after that dusk, you win (killing all other players)
* During the day, enfranchise to gain 3x voting power
    - Everyone is told you enfranchised
    - From now on, you can't whisper or be whispered to
wiki.article.role.politician.abilities:
* You may enfranchise during the day to gain 3x voting power
* If the town would win while you are alive, instead the game instantly goes to nominations and all players are told the politician is about to win. If you survive this trial, you win and all non-politicians die
* You can't whisper or be whispered to
wiki.article.role.politician.attributes:
* You win with other politicians
* If there are no town loyalists alive, you leave town.
* You have armor
wiki.article.role.politician.extra: * If the only players left are politicians, you win
wiki.article.role.arsonist.reminder: Each night, douse a player in gasoline. Ignite to attack all doused players.
wiki.article.role.arsonist.guide:
- Select a player to douse them in gasoline
- Select yourself to ignite and attack every player who is doused
- You know who is doused

Try not to douse players you think the syndicate will kill, because then you waste your night dousing someone who is going to die anyway.
wiki.article.role.arsonist.abilities:
* Visit a player to douse them
* Visit yourself to ignite to all doused players
* If a player visits you, you will douse them
wiki.article.role.arsonist.attributes:
* You can't be doused
* You are shown who is doused
* All doused players have a suspicious aura while you are alive
wiki.article.role.arsonist.extra:
* If you are roleblocked, you still douse visitors
* Igniting a is an indirect, protection-piercing attack
* When you ignite, you don't attack dead players
* When you become an arsonist, you clean the gas off yourself
* An arsonist can not be attacked by an arsonist igniting
wiki.article.role.werewolf.reminder: On some nights, rampage a player, attacking them and all visitors to them. On other nights, choose a player to track their scent.
wiki.article.role.werewolf.guide:
You have a different ability depending on whether or not it is a full moon tonight. It is a full moon every night except night 1 and 3.
- On full moon nights
    - Select someone to attack them and rampage, attacking everyone else who visits that player
    - Select nobody to rampage yourself, attacking everyone who visits you
- On non full moon nights
    - Select someone to gain their scent
    - Passively gain the scent of everyone who visits you
    - You have an innocent aura
- Every night
    - If you have someones scent, you are told who they visit

 Try to attack players who will get visited by many people in order to kill more players. The information you receive can help you claim town investigative roles such as the Tracker
wiki.article.role.werewolf.abilities:
* On full moon nights
    * Visit a player to attack and rampage
    * If you visit nobody, you rampage yourself
* On non-full moon nights
    * Visit a player to gain their scent
    * You passively gain the scent of every player that visits you
    * You have an innocent aura
wiki.article.role.werewolf.attributes:
* You track each player you have the scent of. You are told who each player you are tracking visits.
* You still track the scent of players after you die
* Your attack is armor-piercing
wiki.article.role.werewolf.extra:
* You attack yourself if you visit yourself
* A roleblock has no effect on you besides erasing your visits. If you are roleblocked, it is as if you visited nobody
* You don't visit players attacked by a rampage
wiki.article.role.ojo.reminder: Each night, select up to two outlines to learn the roles generated from them. Each night*, attack all players with a role you select.
wiki.article.role.ojo.guide:
- You have multiple night abilities
 - Each night, select up to 2 outlines, for each outline, you are told what role generated from that outline
 - Each night except the first, select a role, you attack all players with that role
 - You see the role of all players who visit you, their role is revealed to you, this is a passive ability
wiki.article.role.ojo.abilities:
- You have multiple night abilities
 - Each night, select up to 2 outlines, for each outline, you are told what role generated from that outline
 - Each night except the first, select a role, you attack all players with that role
 - You see the role of all players who visit you, their role is revealed to you, this is a passive ability
wiki.article.role.ojo.attributes:
- If you are dead, you cant select to use your ability
* If you are blocked, you have no ability
* Your attack is an armor-piercing attack
* You can't attack anybody on night 1
wiki.article.role.ojo.extra:
- Your attack ability works on the person you actually visited, so if a transporter transports a player you visit with someone else, you attack the other player, this only applies to the attack ability, not any other ability of yours
- You wont visit dead players using your attack ability
- You are immune to possession, but not wardblocks or roleblocks
wiki.article.role.puppeteer.reminder: Each night, select a player to either poison them or recruit them.
wiki.article.role.puppeteer.guide:
- You may choose to do one of the following
    - Select and poison a player
        - They are told they are poisoned, and then they are attacked the next night

    - Select a player to string up into a marionette
        - They are told they are strung up, and that they will win with fiends, regardless of their role
        - They attacked the following night, and every night until they die
        - They should try their hardest to help you and should NOT say they were strung up
 - At night all puppeteers and marionettes can chat in the puppeteer chat, even if dead
    - The players in the puppeteer chat that are dead can chat during the day or night
wiki.article.role.puppeteer.abilities:
- You may choose to do one of the following
    - Visit a player to poison them
        - They are told they are poisoned
        - They are indirectly hit with an armor-piercing attack on the following night

    - Visit a player to string up into a marionette
        - They are told they are strung up, and they now win with fiends, regardless of their role
        - They will be indirectly hit with a protection-piercing attack every night by all puppeteers until they die, if there are no puppeteers they are still attacked
        - You can only use this X times (X = Total players √∑ 5 (round up))
wiki.article.role.puppeteer.attributes:
- You and the marionettes are all puppeteer insiders
- Stringing someone up is armor-piercing, if a player has higher defense than armor when you attempt to string them up, they are instead poisoned
 - At night all puppeteers and marionettes can chat in the puppeteer chat, even if dead
    - The players in the puppeteer chat that are dead can chat during the day or night
wiki.article.role.puppeteer.extra:
- You can't select anybody who is a puppeteer, marionette, or is being strung into a marionette
- A puppeteer can't be stringed into a marionette
- A marionette can't be stringed into a marionette twice, if 2 puppeteers choose a player to be turned into a marionette on the same night, they get the message only once
wiki.article.role.kira.reminder: Each night, guess players roles, if all your guesses are correct, you attack all of the players you guessed.
wiki.article.role.kira.guide:
- Each night, guess players roles, if all your guesses are correct, you attack all of the players you guessed.
- You can choose not to guess a players role by selecting none, this doesn't count as a wrong guess
- Each night you get a result, for each guess, you are told if your guess was correct, incorrect but someone has that role, or incorrect and nobody has that role
- You can't attack night 1, but you can still make guesses

_For Example_
- You guess @1 is a lookout, @2 is a tracker, and don't guess anyone else by selecting none. If @1 is a lookout, @2 is a tracker, you attack @1 and @2, but nobody else.
wiki.article.role.kira.abilities:
- Each night, make a guess for every living player
    - Your options for guesses are, any specific town role, none, and non town. So if they aren't town, you don't need to know their exact role
    - If all of your guesses are one of either correct or none, you attack all of the players you guessed correctly with an indirect armor-piercing attack
- Every night, you get a result
    - For each player you guessed as something non none, you learn one of three things
        - Your guess is correct, that player has that role
        - Your guess is incorrect, that player doesn't have that role, but someone else in the game does have that role
        - Your guess is incorrect, that player doesn't have that role, and nobody else in the game has that role
- If it is night 1, you don't attack anyone, but you still get your result
wiki.article.role.kira.attributes:
- You don't visit anyone
- Your attack is armor-piercing
- You don't attack anyone night 1
wiki.article.role.kira.extra:
- You can't guess dead players or yourself, nor can you attack them
* If you are blocked, your ability does nothing
wiki.article.role.pyrolisk.reminder: Each night*, select a player to attack them. You passively attack everyone who visits you. Everyone you kill is obscured.
wiki.article.role.pyrolisk.guide:
- Each night except the first, select a player to attack them, and obscure them
- You passively attack and obscure everyone who visits you
- On night 1, you can't attack anyone, and you have innocent aura
- You are told the players you obscures role and alibi
wiki.article.role.pyrolisk.abilities:
* On night 1
    * You can't attack
    * You have innocent aura
* On other nights
    * Visit a player to attack them
    * All players who visit you are attacked
* All players you attacked and killed have their grave obscured and you are told their role and alibi
wiki.article.role.pyrolisk.extra: * If you are roleblocked, you still attack visitors, but you don't visit anyone, so you wont attack the player you chose
wiki.article.role.spiral.reminder: Each night*, select a player to attack, all visitors to them spiral, dying the next night.
wiki.article.role.spiral.guide:
- Each night except the first, select a player to attack and spiral all visitors to them
    - Players die the night after they begin to spiral
    - The night a player dies to spiraling, all visitors to them begin to spiral, causing a potential chain reaction
- You can't spiral a player if any player is still spiraling
wiki.article.role.spiral.abilities:
- Each night except the first, select a player to attack and spiral all visitors to them
    - Players die the night after they begin to spiral
    - The night a player dies to spiraling, all visitors to them begin to spiral, causing a potential chain reaction
- You can't spiral a player if any player is still spiraling
wiki.article.role.spiral.attributes:
- Players are not told when they start to spiral
* If you are blocked, spiraling players still die
* Your attack is armor piercing
wiki.article.role.spiral.extra:
- You can't cause yourself to spiral
- If a dead player is spiraling, they stay spiraling, and you attack them again, even while they are dead. Although they cannot die after already dead.
wiki.article.role.fiendsWildcard.reminde: Choose a fiends role to become at start of night.
wiki.article.role.fiendsWildcard.guide:
* Choose a fiends role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You can't become a role that has exceeded its role limit
wiki.article.role.fiendsWildcard.abiliti: * Become a role you choose at the start of night
wiki.article.role.fiendsWildcard.attribu:
* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can not become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.fiendsWildcard.extra:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the Fiends Wildcard
* You can choose Fiends Wildcard to stay as Fiends Wildcard
* You can't become a role that is at its role limit
wiki.article.role.apostle.reminder: Each night, carry out the task of the cult.
wiki.article.role.apostle.guide:
- At night, either kill or convert
    - If the cult can convert tonight, select a player to convert
    - If the cult can kill tonight and there is no zealot, select a player to kill
wiki.article.role.apostle.abilities:
* On nights the cult kills
    * If you are the only cultist, visit a player to attack
* On nights the cult convert
    * Visit a player to convert them to a Zealot on the cultist team
wiki.article.role.apostle.attributes: * You can't convert a player who has any defense
wiki.article.role.apostle.extra:
* There can only be one Apostle, if you die, the next oldest cultist becomes an Apostle
*  Once you convert a player to a zealot, the previous zealot (if any) becomes a disciple
* You can not select other cultists
- Converting is not an attacking visit, but attacking is
wiki.article.role.disciple.guide:
- If an Apostle dies, and you are the next oldest cultist, you are converted to an Apostle
    - Oldest cultist means that you were a cultist before any other player was, and if there is a tie, then the player with a lower player number is the oldest

Even though you have no ability you are essential to your team. You should lie and communicate with fellow cultists to convince the town to execute someone who isn't a cultist.
wiki.article.role.disciple.abilities: * When an Apostle dies and you are the oldest cultist, you will become an Apostle
wiki.article.role.disciple.attributes: * The oldest cultist is the one that has been a cultist the longest. If there is a tie, the oldest cultist is the one with the lowest player number
wiki.article.role.zealot.reminder: On cult kill nights, you attack a player instead of the apostle attacking a player.
wiki.article.role.zealot.guide:
- At night, if the cult is killing tonight, select a player to attack them
- You become a disciple when another player is converted to zealot

Make sure you don't choose the same player as an Apostle, because then you might kill a cultist.
wiki.article.role.zealot.abilities: * If it is a night the cult kills, visit a player to attack
wiki.article.role.zealot.attributes: * When another player is converted to a zealot, you become a disciple.
wiki.article.role.zealot.extra:
* There can never be more than one zealot
* You can not select other cultists
